snippet: A mediocre fourth quarter means that bankers in New York and London are unlikely to improve on their total compensation from 2012 — and that could be the case for the next couple of years, say Antony Currie and Dominic Elliott of Reuters...
abstract: A mediocre fourth quarter means that bankers in New York and London are unlikely to improve on their total compensation from 2012 — and that could be the case for the next couple of years, say Antony Currie and Dominic Elliott of Reuters Breakingviews.

byline.original: By ANTONY CURRIE and DOMINIC ELLIOTT
